nodes.bodyText: Wouldn't it be more logical that the component isn't attached anymore when the UI is closed / removed?

I agree, that also sounds more intuitive to me; also that's how Vaadin 8 used to work. However, with Vaadin 14 the onDetach()/detach listeners are also not fired when the UI is closed - this tells me that there is a bigger work needed to be done. Could you please open a new bug report in this regard, so that it can be discussed separately?

ui.close() only marks the ui as closing * Marks this UI to be detached from the session at the end of the current request and the actual cleanup and detach for the UI happens in the VaadinService when the request has been handled.
So the actual simulated close would be ui.getInternals().setSession(null); (NOTE that the existing session can not be null in this case)
This can also be true if the UI has "detached" (e.g. closed and removed from the session)

That sounds weird. The attach/detach thing served as a means to lazy-init+destroy a component when it became visible (or active on-screen). With Vaadin 14 the detach may not even be called at all, which just sounds plain wrong.
I just tried ui.close() + ui.internals.session=null: the UI including all of its components becomes detached 👍
